item.title: PyMC3 tutorial on Mixture Models
item.description: PyMC3 tutorial on Mixture Models 3/6/2021 • PA,USA In this post, I talk about using PyMC3 to create a probabilistic model to estimate parameters of a mixture model using simulated data. I have used a mixture modeling approach in the past to predict the accuracy of planar, laser-based experimental imaging for measuring flame speeds in turbulent flames. You can read more about it in this paper. For this post, I am creating synthetic data mimicking a sphere shrinking in size and moving in space, while passing through a fixed plane.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications Google Scholar Profile “Impact of turbulence on the coherent flame dynamics in a bluff-body stabilized flame”, A Karmarkar, A Tyagi, S Hemchandra, J O’Connor, Proceedings of the Combustion Institute, 2020. Link “Towards a method of estimating out-of-plane effects on measurements of turbulent flame dynamics”, A Tyagi, J O’Connor, Combustion and Flame, 2020. Link | PDF “Development of a Diagnostic Damkohler Number for Interpreting Laser-Induced Fluorescence Data in Turbulent Flames”, K Beseler, A Tyagi, J O’Connor, AIAA Scitech 2020 Forum, 2020.

item.title: About
item.description: A Mechanical Engineer by training, I hold a Ph.D. focused on Experimental Combustion research. I currently work at Eriez Manufacturing as an R&D Digital Signal Processing Engineer and have experience working as a Process Engineer at Intel Corporation. Through the academic and industry roles that I have navigated so far, I have developed a strong skill set in experimental research, metrology, and advanced data analysis methods. My recent interests include: • Computer vision, digital image and signal processing methods • Statistical data analysis, probabilistic modeling • Computational problem solving, inverse problems • Laser diagnostics, metrology, imaging techniques • The art of espresso
